comments.text:
[Naoto is my spirit animal!](http://imgur.com/a/eMIgd)

Seriously this kid is just great! Just when I thought he can't get anymore shameless he pulls of something like that. Now I wonder what kind of body they'll get for Halter.


[](#head-tilt)
For half a second I thought they had put Halter in the pleasure automata.

[Oh shit, what is he gonna do???](http://i.imgur.com/fY5hHpO.jpg) ... [Right, forgot who we were talking about.](http://i.imgur.com/1pERPQ4.jpg)

Can't hardly blame him when the chief clockmaker is making automatons for.. [this.](http://i.imgur.com/6eS9Jna.jpg)
The t-shirt fucking sold it. Merchandise when?

Automaton strip bar. Perfect.

You can indulge in your hobby, have the comfort of women, and partake in your ~~questionably~~ 100% illegal activities in an underground workshop.

Best part is when people question why you have a legion of stripper automatons and a strip bar, you can say it's all a front to hide my illegal workshop.

> Best part is when people question why you have a legion of stripper automatons and a strip bar, you can say it's all a front to hide my illegal workshop

[The only answer needed](http://i.imgur.com/LntkDyS.png)

"Why do you have an illegal workshop ?"

"It's all an excuse for my automaton stripper bar."
Wow actual sex bots, Naoto as a trap and AnchoR being adorable? Great episode.
This show knows what we want.
[Don't fist them](http://i.imgur.com/XeXCfLZ.jpg)
[Safety first.](http://i3.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/001/069/590/bd2.png)

*Puts on durable gloves.*

I'm going in.

Great episode. Though I can't say if Naoto is either a great otosan or a great [okaasan] (http://i.imgur.com/1ofbMVm.jpg).  
  
As King said, he is really a A+ trap material.  
  
Anchor-chan is just:  
[**OVERLOAD**Cuteness](#everythingisfine)  
  
[MUST](http://i.imgur.com/s0GB6uO.jpg) [PROTECT](http://i.imgur.com/71AgxJJ.jpg) [THAT](http://i.imgur.com/KNSCxS0.jpg) [SMILE](http://i.imgur.com/7cKMUgP.jpg)!!!
Idk why people ever got the impression that this was a show about hard science. What even is Naoto? Is there a male character in any other anime even remotely similar to him?
Since when has ~~steam~~gearpunk been hard science?
He's like a less perverted version of Araragi.
Or more, but just happens to be younger and thus purer.

Another nice ep.  Seeing the cahracters flushed out more is nice, and we get some more reasoning for the actions of the antagonists.  

Naoto is A+ trap material in that disguise.  

Seeing him spending time having fun with AnchoR was really nice.  Marie just over thinks things but it seems like shes finally on board with naoto.  

Next week looks like its gonna be eventful.  Im really enjoying this series.  Its just so entertaining.  

[](#meguminthumbsup)

> Marie just over thinks things but it seems like shes finally on board with naoto.

i think this episode did a great job outlining the contrast between Marie and Naoto and them wanting qualities of the other. Marie is very analytical and careful with her work and ideas having a strong education whereas Naoto is carefree and spontaneous with his ideas and no academic training with clockworks. Marie wants more of Naoto's intuition and Naoto wants Marie's skills.

> flushed out 

Fleshed* out?  Or have I been misunderstanding this saying my whole life...?
Nah, he just had a typo. Or a pun that went over my head.

>Naoto is A+ trap material in that disguise

Fucking make him a female and i'm sold, i was just surprised by how perfect that trap was lmao.

I'm sad we didnt get ryuZU this week ;(

Trap Naoto was awesome. And that reveal when he mentioned looking for a way to attack the people who hurt RyuZU was fantastic!

Also, we've got some confirmation on the purpose of his headphones. Looks like super heading does have its drawbacks. I hope that comes up later.

"Wait, could it be that I'm cute?"

"*Die.*"

Had a genuine laugh at that one, and interestingly enough, Naoto is turning out to be an oddly unique and interesting character despite not coming across as one at all earlier in the show.

> despite not coming across as one at all earlier in the show

[Whatcha talkin about](http://i.imgur.com/a7Jf237.jpg)? He always had that going for him.
I think only the first episode and maybe second gives an excuse to believe that. Everything after that has been fantastic as far as I'm concerned. Literally the moment he learned about AnchoR.
How much in pain would Naoto be without his noise cancelling headphones. I wonder what the schools are even teaching students if Naoto can't even do Middle School level stuff.
He didnt exactly seem like the perfect student, but i could be wrong.  He could easily have no paid much attention in class and not learn because of it
I got that impression as well. For whatever reason, he just doesn't learn very well, at least not in a textbook fashion.

"Man, being alive is not hard at all because my daughter is so cute!"

Naoto is carrying this show on his back.
Naoto, RyuZU and Marie have always been fantastic to me, but now AnchoR as well? This show is wonderful. Easily one of my top 4 this season.
joseph jostar sounding old man running a robot strip club...

[BTW, source material (the light novel) got licensed by J-Novel Club.](http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2017/06/01/j-novel-club-licenses-clockwork-planet-light-novels)  The first volume will be released in digital format in August.

And if anyone wonders,  the anime is pretty bad ***compared*** to the source material. They didn't really do a good job with the adaptation.
If this is considered pretty bad in comparison, I absolutely have to read the source. I'm loving this show so far!

It probably is worth it. OP might say that the show is bad compared to the source, but it is very obvious that the source is where the strengths of the show come from. Character design, interactions, setting, motivations - those are not the kind of things that are reinvented for an adaptation.
My sentiments exactly. I'm freaking loving this show, and if this is a bad adaptation, good Lord I can't wait for the light Novels.

While most manga to anime adaptations turn out pretty good, the same is not true for adaptations of light novels. Due to anime having a limited budget thus limited runtime a lot of content is cut-out. Another example of this would be "Akashic records of the bastard Magical Instructor" where 5 volumes are being adapted into 12 episodes. In comparison, one of the best anime adaptations of a light novel - Sword Art Online adapted 2 volumes into 12 episodes.

P. S.  I am NOT saying SAO is the best anime. Only that it is a pretty well done adaptation of the source material.


EDIT: MISTAKES WERE MADE....

> P. S. I am saying SAO is the best anime. 

I see...
Did a mod edit my reply or am I really that retarded?
I mean if we're just looking at volumes per episodes, then Horizon in the Middle of Nowhere comes out on top. Each 12 episode season adapts one novel.

In fairness, [there are reasons](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/7/7c/A-Certain-Magical-Index_and_Horizon-on-the-Middle-of-Nowhere_novels_published_by_Dengeki_Bunko_20140517.jpg) for that.

Just to be clear, the Horizon stack is the first three volumes of the series (in either two or three parts each).
The amount of cuteness in this episode...
I need moar trap naoto
It looks like Naoto ended up liking the extensions.
Damn, so it was not Halter but the other dude... What a let down.

[This guy tho](http://i.imgur.com/ksNgIIc.jpg).

[Unexpected, but I approve of the turn of events](http://i.imgur.com/TAVTo1J.jpg).

That was a pretty interesting ep.

> Unexpected, but I approve of the turn of events.

Sweet, sweet revenge for Marie. Also possibly the best non-serious revenge I have ever seen.
Why does Anchor need to "charge"? Charge what? Can't he just wind her up?
[Ueno did nothing wrong](http://i.imgur.com/53O1frO.jpg)
wow if only marie was a bit older and was grown in developed areas she would look hot AF with the ponytail
